THIS RESULTED IN THE BNSF 473321 JACK-KNIFING AND FALLING ON ITS SIDE AS WELL.  ALL WHEELS DERAILED ON BNSF 473061, BNSF 476343 AND BNSF474189.ALL WHEELS ON LEADING END AND BOTH WHEELS ON EAST SIDE OF BNSF 472310 DERAILED. THE LINE IS FROM PORT JERVIS NY TO SUFFERN, NY IS OWNED BY NORFOLK SOUTHERN AND LEASED AND MAINTAINEDBY METRO-NORTH RAILROAD.  METRO-NORTH HAS PLANS TO BUY THIS LINE IN THE FUTURE.  TRAINS ARE OPERATED BY NEW JERSEY TRANSIST UNDER CONTRACT TO METRO-NORTH.  FOR THIS INCIDENT, THE TRAIN SHOULD BE CONSIDERED A METERO-NORTH TRAIN.  THE EQUIPMENT IS POOLED BETWEEN METRO-NORTH AND NEW JERSEY TRANSIST OWNED EQUIPMENT.  THE CREW IS EMPLOYED BY NEW JERSEY TRANSIST.  FRA FORM 6180.81 FILED - NJTR EMPLOYEE.

185734-d-05-19-04-SOO.Primary Accident Cause: Other train operation/human factors (Provide detailed description in narrative)
185734-d-05-19-04-SOO.Accident Cause: Other train operation/human factors (Provide detailed description in narrative)
185734-d-05-19-04-SOO.Narrative: TRAIN 387-18 IN THE PROCESS OF PICKING UP LOADED CARS AND TIED ONTO ONE TRACK AND THEN DOUBLED TO TWO TRACK (HOUSE TRACK).   CONDUCTOR MADE JOINT AND STRETCHED THE SLACK APPROXIMATELY ONE-HALF A CAR LENGTH AND CUT IN THE AIR.  CONDUCTOR BOARDED THE CAR AT THE JOINT AND INSTRUCTED THE STUDENT ENGINEER TO PULL WEST ONTO THE MAIN TRACK.  CONDUCTOR DISMOUNTED NEAR THE DERAIL ON THE WEST END WHEN HE NOTICED SPARKS AND INSTRUCTED THE ENGINEER TO STOP.  STUDENT ENGINEER PLACED THE BRAKE INTO EMERGENCYAND CAME TO A STOP.  UPON INSPECTION, CONDUCTOR FOUND LOAD CP 388682 DERAILED.  IT WAS DETERMINED THAT THE EAST CAR WAS SHOVED OVER THE EAST DERAIL AND THEN DRAGGED THE ENTIRE LENGTH OF THE TRACK WHENTHE SECOND WHEEL DERAILED NEAR THE FROG ON THE WEST END AND FOULED THE THE MAIN LINE.      INVESTIGATION WAS SCHEDULED FOR JUNE 8, 2004.  CONDUCTOR RESIGNED FROM THE SERVICE OF THE COMPANY ON JUNE 7,2004.    CAUSE:  CARS ON NO. 2 TRACK WERE TOO CLOSE TO THE DERAIL ON EAST END.  WHEN THE AIR BRAKESWERE CUT IN, THE SLACK ROLLED EAST CAUSING ONE SET OF TRUCKS ON CP 388682 TO GO OVER THE DERAIL.  CONDUCTOR DID NOT REALIZE THIS AND PROCEEDED TO INSTRUCT THE ENGINEER TO PULL WEST AND DERAILED CAR TO TRAVEL THE LENGTH OF THE TRACK UNTIL CONDUCTOR NOTICED THE SPARKS AND STOPPED THE MOVEMENT.    7/30/04 - COSTS INCURRED TO ELEVATOR OWNED HOUSE TRACK IS $7,632 AND IS MAINTAINED BY SOO/CP.   COSTS INCURRED TO SOO/CP OWNED/MAINTAINED TRACK IS $2,000.  TOTAL TRACK COSTS INCURRED AS A RESULT OF THIS

12004-d-05-24-04-STMA.Primary Accident Cause: Other truck component defects, (LOCOMOTIVE) (Provide  detailed description in narrative)
12004-d-05-24-04-STMA.Accident Cause: Other truck component defects, (LOCOMOTIVE) (Provide  detailed description in narrative)
12004-d-05-24-04-STMA.Narrative: UNION PACIFIC LIT42 TRAIN WAS BACKING ITS LOCOMOTIVE CONSIST INTO ST. MARIES RIVER RAILROAD'S PLUMMER EAST PASS TRACK FOR THE PURPOSE OF REDUCING THE LOCOMOTIVE CONSIST PRIOR TO SWITCHING INDUSTRIES LOCATED IN PLUMMER.  THE PURPOSE FOR REDUCING CONSIST WAS LOCOMOTIVE UP 3160.  UP 3160 IS 3 AXLE TRUCK ROAD LOCOMOTIVE DEEMED TOO RIGID AND HEAVY TO USE WHILE SWITCHING UP INDUSTRY AT PLUMMER.  IN PROCESS OF BACKING INTO THE EAST PASS TRACK, THE THIRD LOCOMOTIVE, A TWO AXLE TRUCK LOCOMOTIVE NEGOTIATED THE FACING POINT MOVE WITH NO INCIDENT.  THE 2ND LOCOMOTIVE, UP3160'S, LEAD WHEEL OF REAR TRUCK CLIMBED OVER/SPLIT SWITCH POINT, RODE RAIL BALL =/- THIRTY FEET AND DERAILED TO THE FIELD SIDE.  CONSIST MOVED APPROXIMATELY ONE CAR LENGTH.  LATERAL FORCE DESTROYED SWITCH POINTS, BENT 60' OF RAIL ANDDAMAGED 35 SWITCH TIES.  FOLLOWING DERAILMENT, INSPECTION INDICATED SWITCH POINT HAD BEEN BROKEN.  ST MARIES RIVER RAILROAD HAS NOT REPAIRED DAMAGE AS OF THIS SUBMISSION BUT ANTICIPATES REPAIR IN SEPTEMBER.  ESTIMATED COST TO REPAIR $6,000.
